metadata.title: CVE-2015-8724 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The AirPDcapDecryptWPABroadcastKey function in epan/crypt/airpdcap.c in the802.11 dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.9 and 2.0.x before 2.0.1does not verify the WPA broadcast key length, which allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) viaa crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8724` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1').
